Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi

Class JmsDestination

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi.Resource
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi.JmsDestination
  • public final class JmsDestination
extends Resource
    Corresponds to a jms-destination element in a deployment descriptor.
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Constructor Detail

      • JmsDestination

        public JmsDestination()

    • Method Detail

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription​(java.lang.String description)
        Sets a description of this JMS destination. Corresponds to the description element within jms-destination in the deployment descriptor.
        Parameters:
        description - a textual description of this destination
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.5: JMS Destination

      • setName

        public void setName​(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the JNDI name by which this destination will be registered. Corresponds to the name element in the deployment descriptor.

        The name must be a valid JNDI name, typically in the form java:comp/env/jms/queue/MyQueue or java:comp/env/jms/topic/MyTopic.

        Parameters:
        name - the JNDI name for this destination
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.5: JMS Destination

      • setInterfaceName

        public void setInterfaceName​(java.lang.String interfaceName)
        Sets the interface implemented by this destination. Corresponds to the interface-name element in the deployment descriptor.

        Valid values are javax.jms.Queue or javax.jms.Topic. If not specified, the interface is inferred from the JNDI name.

        Parameters:
        interfaceName - the destination interface class name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.5: JMS Destination

      • setClassName

        public void setClassName​(java.lang.String className)
        Sets the fully-qualified class name of the destination implementation. Corresponds to the class-name element in the deployment descriptor.
        Parameters:
        className - the destination implementation class name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.5: JMS Destination
